Detailed Description

template<typename Point, unsigned DIM, typename CType>
class sfcnn_ip< Point, DIM, CType >

An in-place space filling curve nearest neighbor class.

This is the workhorse class for the sfcnn_ip class. The In place Space Filling Curve Nearest Neighbor (SFCNN_IP) algorithm sorts the input data set into 2-order Morton ordering. Nearest neighbors are then calculated based on that curve. The algorithm has a runtime of O(ln(N)) and a construction time of O(Nlog(N)). This version operates on user data instead of a copy. The query functions of the algorithm are thread-safe.

Initializes an sfcnn_ip object.

Parameters:
p Pointer to the input data set
N Size of the input data set
numthreads (Optional) Number of threads to use in construction (1)
sorted (Optional) Non-zero indicates data is sorted in Z-order already (0)

void sfcnn_ip< Point, Dim, CType >::ksearch ( Point  q,
unsigned int  k,
vector< long unsigned int > &  nn_idx,
float  eps = 0 
) [inline]

Nearest Neighbor search function.

Searches for the k nearest neighbors to the point q. The answer vector returned will contain the indexes to the answer points This function is thread-safe.

Parameters:
q The query point
k The number of neighbors to return
nn_idx Answer vector
eps Error tolerence, default of 0.0.
sl Unused, for backwards compatibility

References qknn::answer(), and BinarySearch().
